#summary Description of GW's Dialog Format.

= Introduction =
GW uses some kind of html code to specify Dialogues.

= Format Description =

*Html alike Tags:*

|| *Tag* || *Function* || *Example* ||
|| `<brx>` || new Line || ||
|| `<a>` || Button || `<a=DialogID>`This is a Button`</a>` ||
|| `<c=#rgb>` || Colorize Text || `<c=#D9D9E8>`This text is blue `</c>` ||
|| `<p>` || Paragraph || ||

*Special Strings:*

|| male form`[f: "female form"]` || Displays Text based on Character gender ||


*The Following seems to Work for Hashed Format strings only!*

*Fomat Strings:*

|| %numX% || inserts number argument X -0x100 into the string and determines if plural or not||
|| %strX% || inserts string argument X into the string ||

*Argument numerating:*

Plain str = 0x0A,0x01,0x03,0x00 str1 0x01,0x00,0x01,0x00,0x0B,0x01,0x03,0x00 str2   

or

0x07,0x01 str1 0x01,0x00,0x0B,0x01,0x03,0x00 str2


            
Plain num = 0x01,0x01 2byte number

*Splitting Arguments*

|| 0x01,0x00 || End of Argument chain||
|| 0x01,0x00 || Number Argument ||
|| 0x02,0x00 || Hash ||
|| 0x03,0x00 || Plain Text ||
